message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL 

The paper deals with computer vision and robotics, specifically with the problem of estimating a top-view representation of outdoor scenes from a single RGB image. This falls under the category of computer vision (cs.CV). The paper proposes a convolutional neural network for this task, which involves learning to predict occluded portions of the scene layout by looking around foreground objects like cars or pedestrians. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories of robotics (cs.RO) and machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of simulated or map data to learn priors and rules about typical road layouts, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and computational linguistics (cs.CL).
